title: 106_hr4067
content: The Act titled "Business Checking Modernization Act" includes amendments related to demand deposit accounts at depository institutions. The Business Checking Modernization Act amends the Federal Reserve Act and the Home Owners' Loan Act to allow up to 24 transfers per month from interest-bearing accounts to demand deposit accounts within the same institution. The Business Checking Modernization Act amends the Home Owners' Loan Act to allow up to 24 transfers per month from interest-bearing accounts to demand deposit accounts within the same institution. The Business Checking Modernization Act amends the Home Owners' Loan Act to allow transfers between accounts within the same institution, with certain limitations. The Business Checking Modernization Act amends the Home Owners' Loan Act to allow up to 24 transfers per month between accounts within the same institution, for any purpose, to a demand deposit account of the owner. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to repeal the prohibition on payment of interest on demand deposits. The Home Owners' Loan Act is also amended to allow savings associations to permit any transactions. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act is amended as well. These amendments will take effect after a 3-year period from the enactment of the Act. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to increase flexibility in setting reserve requirements, allowing for a ratio not greater than 3 percent and removing the minimum requirement of 8 percent.
